sentence.Network_en: He sat listening to the tick of the grandfather clock.
sentence.Network_cn: 他坐在那儿，听着落地式大摆钟嘀嗒作响。

sentence.Network_en: My great-grandfather was a person of some importance here.
sentence.Network_cn: 我曾祖父曾是这儿的头面人物。

sentence.Network_en: My great-grandfather made horseshoes and nails and what have you.
sentence.Network_cn: 我曾祖父打制马掌、铁钉等诸如此类的东西。

entry.def: Your grandfather is the father of your father or mother.

example.tran: 他的爷爷曾是一名教授。

means.word_mean: 1. the father of your father or mother

Sentence.sentence: If you tell an acquaintance you are a grandfather who recently lost his wife and who does volunteer work on weekends, several elements of your self-image are bought to light — the roles of grandparent, widower and conscientious citizen.
My grandfather served in World War II, and I hope to be just like him someday.
What are you going to do with the old house you are in heritage from your grandfather?

sentences.en: His grandfather is a veteran of the Second World War.
sentences.cn: 他的祖父是一位参加过二战的老战士。

jushi.english: His grandfather became ill from anxiety.
jushi.chinese: 他的爷爷由于焦虑而病倒了。

jushi.english: His grandfather is a veteran of the Second World War.
jushi.chinese: 他的祖父是一位参加过第二次世界大战的老战士。

jushi.english: Although he is over 70, my grandfather is very strong.
jushi.chinese: 尽管我爷爷70多岁了,但他仍然很健壮。
